description: Surrogate key for the audit log detail row; unique identifier for each field-level change captured.
Reference to the parent audit transaction that groups all field changes made in a single operation.
String representation of the business key(s) of the affected record, as captured from the source table at change time.
Name of the source table column whose value changed; in maintenance contexts, may include readings, dates, technician, status, or shop fields.
Full-length prior value of the field before the change, stored in a long/text-capable column to preserve large or precise data.
Full-length new value of the field after the change, stored in a long/text-capable column to preserve large or precise data.
Binary or large-object storage for the new value when the change involves large, non-text data; likely used for files or rich content; confirm with SME.
New value of the changed field stored as text; used for most data types when size fits standard column limits.
Previous value of the changed field stored as text; used for most data types when size fits standard column limits.
Canonical text of the affected record’s primary key(s), often duplicated for readability and search, matching the source table’s identifier format.
Code indicating the data type/category of the logged value (e.g., numeric, text, datetime); meanings are system-specific; confirm code set with SME.
Parsed key component 1 derived from the affected record’s identifier to support indexing and joins; for single-key tables, this holds the primary key value.
Parsed key component 2 for composite keys; blank when not applicable. Enables indexing/filtering on the second part of a multi-column identifier.
Parsed key component 3 for composite keys; blank when not applicable. Enables indexing/filtering on the third part of a multi-column identifier.
Parsed key component 4 for composite keys; blank when not applicable. Enables indexing/filtering on the fourth part of a multi-column identifier.
